sentence.Network_en: He's openly contemptuous of all the major political parties.
She gave a contemptuous little laugh.
Canete's mouth twisted in a contemptuous sneer.
sentence.Network_cn: 卡内特傲慢而轻蔑地撇了撇嘴。

list.abs: 用集装箱运输；集装箱化contamination污染；沾污contemptuous damages微额赔偿金Content
backwardness in her family towards him is due to his cold and contemptuous behavior .她家里人对他的迟疑归咎于他冷淡轻蔑的行为。
the empty empire's emperoran attempt to tempt the contemptuous man .空虚帝国的皇帝试图诱惑那个轻蔑的人。
derisive or contemptuous sound made by vibrating the extended tongue and the lips while exhaling ., 震动突出的舌头和嘴唇 , 同时呵气发出表示责怪或轻蔑的声音.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (in the sense 'despising law and order'): from medieval Latin contemptuosus, from Latin contemptus 'contempt', from contemnere (see contemn)

entry.def: If you are contemptuous of someone or something, you do not like or respect them at all.

example.ex: He was contemptuous of private farmers...
He's openly contemptuous of all the major political parties...

auth_sentence.content: The over-all effect is rude, if not contemptuous.
auth_sentence.res_content: The over-all effect is rude, if not contemptuous.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The over-all effect is rude, if not contemptuous.

auth_sentence.content: I had received the news with contemptuous unbelief.
auth_sentence.res_content: I had received the news with contemptuous unbelief.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I had received the news with contemptuous unbelief.

auth_sentence.content: It's very contemptuous of the electorate.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's very contemptuous of the electorate.

stems_affixes.word_buile: contempt[n.轻视,藐视;受辱,丢脸]+ible..的→adj.令人轻视的
contempt[n.轻视,藐视;受辱,丢脸]+uous……的→adj.表示轻蔑的,藐视的
tempt[v.诱惑,引诱;吸引,使感兴趣]+atious→adj.诱惑性的
at一再+tempt尝试→一再尝试→企图
con共同+tempt尝试→大家都能试下→没什么了不起→轻视,藐视
tempt[v.诱惑,引诱;吸引,使感兴趣]+ation表名词→n.引诱,诱惑;诱惑物
at一再+tempt尝试→一再尝试→企图
con共同+temn=tempt尝试→大家都能试下→没什么了不起→蔑视

stems_affixes.value_cn: 诱惑,引诱;吸引,使感兴趣
stems_affixes.word_buile: tempt尝试→v.诱惑,引诱;吸引,使感兴趣

means.word_mean: 蔑视的;鄙视的;表示轻蔑的

sentences.en: He felt people were contemptuous of his lack of sophistication.
sentences.cn: 他觉得人们看不起他不懂人情世故。

sentences.en: He was utterly contemptuous of her efforts.
